task.title: Draining Oil from the Crank Case
task.shortdesc: Learn when and how to properly drain and replace oil in your vehicle's crank case for optimal engine maintenance.

prereq.p: Ensure you have the following materials:

context.p: Regular oil changes are essential for maintaining your vehicle's engine. For new cars, perform the first oil change after 350 miles, then every 750 miles thereafter.

step.cmd: Remove the plug beneath the flywheel casing to drain the old oil.
Pour one gallon of kerosene oil through the breather pipe.
Turn the engine over 15-20 times to allow the kerosene to cleanse the engine.
step.info: The splashing kerosene will help clean the engine components.

step.cmd: Remove the crank case plug and drain the kerosene oil completely.
step.info: Ensure all kerosene is removed from the crank case depressions.

step.cmd: Pour approximately one quart of lubricating oil into the motor.
Turn the engine over several times.
Remove the crank case plug and drain the flushing oil.
Refill the crank case with fresh oil.

result.p: The engine now has clean oil and is ready for operation.
